meanings.definition: To act as a host or master of ceremonies at an event.
meanings.sent1: At the party, John was compeering the guests with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: She will be compeering the talent show next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat compeered the gathering of birds in the backyard, pretending to be the host.
meanings.sent4: The sun compeered the dawn, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: Compeering the meeting, he welcomed everyone with enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a host or master of ceremonies.
meanings.sent1: His compeering at the wedding was praised by all the guests.
meanings.sent2: The compeering of the event was flawless and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The compeering of the teddy bear picnic by the little girl was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her compeering of the school play was like watching a professional in action.
meanings.sent5: The compeering of the award ceremony made the evening memorable for everyone.
